definition: forbidden area/restricted area/(fig.) sth considered off-limits
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Oxford familiars over the years have got to know the Ashmolean as a forbidding place.
sentences.chinese: 多年来，熟悉牛津的人都将阿什莫尔博物馆视为禁地。

sentences.english: There is one full of mysterious and forbidden temptation.
sentences.chinese: 那里是一片充满了神秘而诱惑的禁地。

sentences.english: My sister's bedroom is forbidden territory to the rest of us.
sentences.chinese: 我姐姐的卧室对我们其余人来说是禁地。

sentences.english: But even his Airness is no longer off limits.
sentences.chinese: 但即使他下榻的不再是禁地。

sentences.english: Its slopes were considered off-limits to humans.
sentences.chinese: 它的斜坡被认为是人类的禁地。

definition: lit. devils' castle/place occupied by sinister forces
lit. nest of devils/place occupied by sinister forces
holy land (of a religion)/sacred place/shrine/holy city (such as Jerusalem, Mecca etc)/center of historic interest
